columns.name: config_id
columns.description: Unique identifier of the configuration record (primary key).

columns.name: file_name
columns.description: Name/pattern of the file to retrieve and process (e.g., a .dat file).

columns.name: last_treatment
columns.description: Timestamp of the last successful processing run for this configuration.

columns.name: ftp
columns.description: Source type/label for file retrieval (e.g., 'remote' FTP/SFTP).

columns.name: ftp_ip
columns.description: FTP server hostname or IP address.

columns.name: ftp_user
columns.description: Username used to authenticate to the FTP server.

columns.name: ftp_password
columns.description: Credential/secret used to authenticate to the FTP server (should be stored encrypted/secured).

columns.name: ftp_directory
columns.description: Remote directory path where the source files are located.

columns.name: payload
columns.description: Configuration payload (typically JSON) describing variables/aliases to extract and map.

columns.name: gateway_id
columns.description: Reference to the gateway/connector responsible for retrieving the file (foreign key).

columns.name: parsing_id
columns.description: Reference to the parsing strategy/version to apply to the retrieved file (foreign key).

columns.name: file_id
columns.description: Optional reference to a specific file record associated with this configuration (foreign key).

columns.name: to_move
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the processed file should be moved after treatment (often stored as a string).

columns.name: active
columns.description: Whether this configuration is enabled and should be considered by the processing pipeline.

columns.name: error_message
columns.description: Last error message encountered when processing this configuration, if any.

columns.name: last_modified
columns.description: Last modification timestamp of the source file on the remote system (when available).

columns.name: keep_folder
columns.description: Whether to keep the remote/local folder structure when moving/archiving processed files.
